posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Just found out today (I know, I know, amazing right) that using the WASD keys to move leaves you flatfooted

WTHF??!!!

And if you Click and Run, obviously you are not Flatfooted while moving.

So why is this a thing?  Well, if you Click and Run, and engage in Combat, you provoke an AoO and you will go last in combat (at least, that seems to be the case with last in combat).  Engaging in Combat with WASD with the walk option active seems to prevent this.

Does anyone have a better way to do movement?

Because it seems all these ways give PCs a huge disadvantage.

I know one can Click and Run while holding Shift and one will walk...but that is soooo slow.

This could be useful for somebody with damage shields who wants to get hit.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
WASD only makes you flatfooted if you're not moving much, but that applies to clicking as well. The problem is that WASD doesn't have the automatic pathfinding that clicking does, so your character can get stuck on mobs during combat and become flatfooted. Running into or away from combat with WASD works exactly the same as clicking.

Personally I use WASD outside of combat and clicking during combat if I need to reposition.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
From what I can see (and have been told) while moving with WASD, there is no "active" action queue (check it when moving) - that leaves you flatfooted to any attack, apparently, until you "click" on an opponent.

So apparently, it is not the same as if you click on an opponent and move towards them (then there is something in the action queue).

So my question then is, if there is nothing in the Action Queue, are you saying that WASD movement is not "flatfooted" to a ranged attack?

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
I tested before posting to make sure that my experience matched up with reality. WASD works the same as clicking provided that you're actually moving. Even running into a wall at an angle can cause your character to avoid becoming flatfooted, although if you run directly into a wall then your character doesn't move enough and becomes flatfooted.
